intro: Andryala arenaria var. ficalhoana, commonly known as the Ficalhoan sandplant, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific coastal regions. It thrives in sandy and saline environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand harsh coastal conditions. The plant exhibits a low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, narrow leaves that reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, arranged in clusters, and it blooms during the dry season. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, this species is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
